Illegal crosses in French public spaces reignite debates over church-state separation
subhead: Calvaries installed on public land in towns in the Alps, on the Mediterranean coast and on the island of Corsica, sometimes with the help of far-right identity movements, have rekindled long-standing tensions around France's 1905 law separating churches and state.

title: Cambodia retaliates against Thailand after air strikes kill civilians and trigger mass evacuations
subhead: The renewed hostilities, after months of sporadic skirmishes and a stalled ceasefire deal, have escalated a century-old territorial dispute and deepened fears of a wider conflict in the region.

title: Closure of Madrid's Café Central signals a city in transition
subhead: The iconic Madrid jazz venue is set to close its doors in early 2026. The decision has sparked a strong reaction as the Spanish capital faces rapid gentrification.

title: 'French secularism, once a means to protect individual freedom, has become a tool to defend a supposed national identity'
subhead: As France marks the 120th anniversary of the 1905 law separating churches and state, a coalition of non-profit organizations warns that the principle of laïcité, the French concept of secularism, is being transformed into a system of citizen surveillance.
